poem:
Title: "In the Confluence of Cultures"

Urban beats thrive on windswept plains,
Blurred lines of hip-hop and leathery reins.
A sack of potatoes in the saddle, perhaps,
Veiled in dust and rhythmic rap.
In the shadow of equestrian size,
Black cowboy's truth against the skies.
Belonging seeds sprout in strange lands,
Marred by hoof prints and spray-painted hands.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
